text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSMedicationUse

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSMedicationUse 0..*EHDSDataSetMedication use model

Elements defined in Ancestors:header
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
header
status 1..1CodeableConceptStatus of actual administration of the medicine (administration status or adherence, according to the use case)
Binding Description: (preferred): For medication lists: HL7 MedicationStatement Adherence Codes (status of the exchanged statement record is assumed to be 'recorded'). For single administrations: HL7 MedicationAdministration Status Codes.
medication 1..1EHDSMedicationDescribes the medicinal product. Depending on the use case, it may be a generic description of medication type, or a specific instance.
reason[x] 0..*Coded reason for the use of the medication (typically diagnosis or symptom)
reasonCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
reasonEHDSConditionEHDSCondition
reasonText 0..1stringReason for the use of the medication (diagnosis, observation, or a procedure) as free text.
dosageInstructions 1..*EHDSDosagingDetails of how medication is/was taken or should be taken. Example: 1 tablet every 24h, for 10 days. For factual single administration tracking, all repeats are registered as separate instances.
timeOfUse[x] 0..1The time frame for which the medication use statement applies. In case of unbounded period (continuous therapy), the Period end element will be valued with an exceptional value.
timeOfUseDateTimedateTime
timeOfUsePeriodPeriod
relatedRequest 0..*EHDSMedicationPrescriptionLink to prescriptions related to this use statement
relatedDispense 0..*EHDSMedicationDispenseLink to a dispense record related to this use statement, not applicable to explicit administration records
note 0..1stringTextual information about the intended use or administration of the medication

Documentation for this format

name: EHDSMedicationUse
title: Medication use model
description: Statement about usage of a medication: this can be a more generic statement like an entry in medication summary, or a documentation of a single administration. When documenting a single administration fact, further restrictions may apply (e.g. no repeats in dosaging information)

element.short: Medication use model
element.definition: Statement about usage of a medication: this can be a more generic statement like an entry in medication summary, or a documentation of a single administration. When documenting a single administration fact, further restrictions may apply (e.g. no repeats in dosaging information)

element.short: Common header for all patient-related data
element.definition: Common header for all patient-related data

element.short: Patient/subject information
element.definition: Patient/subject information

element.short: Business identifier for the object
element.definition: Business identifier for the object

element.short: Resource authoring details
element.definition: Resource authoring details

element.short: Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.
element.definition: Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.

element.short: Date and time of authoring/issuing
element.definition: Date and time of authoring/issuing

element.short: Date and time of the last update to the resource (may be used for technical corrections).
element.definition: Date and time of the last update to the resource (may be used for technical corrections).

element.short: Status of actual administration of the medicine (administration status or adherence, according to the use case)
element.definition: Status of the resource or document

binding.description: For medication lists: HL7 MedicationStatement Adherence Codes (status of the exchanged statement record is assumed to be 'recorded'). For single administrations: HL7 MedicationAdministration Status Codes.

element.short: Reason for the current status of the resource.
element.definition: Reason for the current status of the resource.

element.short: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.
element.definition: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

element.short: Describes the medicinal product. Depending on the use case, it may be a generic description of medication type, or a specific instance.
element.definition: Describes the medicinal product. Depending on the use case, it may be a generic description of medication type, or a specific instance.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS, MyHealth@EU

element.definition: Coded reason for the use of the medication (typically diagnosis or symptom)

element.short: Details of how medication is/was taken or should be taken. Example: 1 tablet every 24h, for 10 days. For factual single administration tracking, all repeats are registered as separate instances.

element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS, MyHealth@EU

element.short: The time frame for which the medication use statement applies. In case of unbounded period (continuous therapy), the Period end element will be valued with an exceptional value.
element.definition: The time frame for which the medication use statement applies. In case of unbounded period (continuous therapy), the Period end element will be valued with an exceptional value.
